gamut.classes package

Submodules

gamut.classes.Calibration module

class gamut.classes.Calibration.Calibration(method: Literal['linear', 'quadratic', 'FWHM'], params: list[float])[source]

Bases: object

Relationship between spectrum channels and other quantities. It uses a funtion and a set of parameters to describe the relationship. When the parameters are unknown, they can be fitted using a set of points.

Initialize the calibration object with the given method and parameters.

Parameters:

  • method – The calibration method to use

  • params – The parameters of the calibration function

property method: Literal['linear', 'quadratic', 'FWHM']

Alias of the curve fitting function.

property params: list[float]

Parameters used in the curve fitting function.

property function: CalibrationFunction

Structured function used in the curve fitting.

property points: list[Tuple[float, float]]

List of points(channel, quantity) for curve fitting.

property points_indexes: list[float]

Indexes of the points used for calibration.

property points_values: list[float]

Values of the points used for calibration.

add_point(point: Tuple[float, float]) → None[source]

Add a point to the points list.

classmethod from_points(method: Literal['linear', 'quadratic', 'FWHM'], points: list[Tuple[float, float]]) → Calibration[source]

Initialize the calibration object with the given method and points. The function parameters are fitted using these points.

Parameters:

  • method – The calibration method to use

  • points – The points used for curve fitting

gamut.classes.Peak module

class gamut.classes.Peak.Peak(location: int, center: float | None = None, height: float | None = None, stderr: float | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a single peak in a spectrum. The only required parameter is the location/index of the peak. Parameters like center or height are optional, depending if the peak has been fitted. Other trivial parameters are stored in the attrs dictionary.

Initialize the peak object with the given location and optional parameters.

Parameters:

  • location – The index of the peak in the spectrum

  • center – The center of the peak

  • height – The height of the peak

property location: int

The center index of the peak.

property center: float | None

The precise center of the peak.

property height: float | None

The height of the peak.

property stderr: float | None

The standard error of the gaussian shape of the peak.

copy() → Peak[source]

Return a deep copy of the peak.

shift_by_index(shift: int) → None[source]

Shift the peak position by a given index

Parameters:

shift – Shift value on the index, positive indicates the right direction.

gamut.classes.Region module

class gamut.classes.Region.Region(left: int, right: int, peaks: list[Peak] | None = None, slope: float | None = None, offset: float | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a region of interest in a spectrum. It requires the left and right indexes of the region, and can contain multiple peaks. Parameters like slope or offset are optional, depending if the baseline has been fitted. Other trivial parameters are optional, and are stored in the attrs dictionary.

Initialize the region object with the given left and right indexes and optional parameters.

Parameters:

  • left – The left index of the region

  • right – The right index of the region

  • peaks – The peaks in the region

  • slope – The slope of the baseline

  • offset – The offset of the baseline

property left: int

The left index of the region.

property right: int

The right index of the region.

property peaks: list[Peak]

The list of peaks in the region.

property npeaks: int

Number of peaks in the region.

property length: int

Length of the region.

property indexes: ndarray

Indexes of the region.

property slope: float | None

The slope of the baseline. Available only if the baseline has been fitted.

property offset: float | None

The offset of the baseline. Available only if the baseline has been fitted.

copy() → Region[source]

Return a deep copy of the region

shift_by_index(shift: int) → None[source]

Shift the region position by a given index, this will also shift the peaks.

Parameters:

shift – int, the shift value

fit_peak(peak: Peak, indexes: ndarray | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Return the fitted spectrum segment using the peak parameters.

Parameters:

  • peak – The peak to fit

  • indexes – The indexes of the region

Returns:

The fitted spectrum segment

fit_baseline(indexes: ndarray | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Return the fitted baseline using the baseline parameters.

Parameters:

indexes – The indexes of the region

Returns:

The fitted baseline
